Package org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class Strings

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Strings
public class Strings
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides utility methods for strings.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    Split a string with delimiters represented by a regular expression.

    Returns a string obtained by (1) splitting a specified string into sections where the maximum width of each section is specified, (2) inserting another specified string between every two successive sections, and (3) combining all back to a string.

    • wrap

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> wrap​(java.lang.String str, int width)
      Breaks a string into lines at a specified width.
      Parameters:
      str - a string
      width - the desired width of a line
      Returns:
      the lines

    • wrap

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> wrap​(java.lang.String str, int width, int indent)
      Breaks a string into lines at a specified width and indents every line. The newlines (except the last one) in the input string remain in the output. Note that except the indent, no space will appear at the beginning of every line.
      Parameters:
      str - a string
      width - the desired width of a line
      indent - the number of spaces to indent
      Returns:
      the lines

    • insert

      public static java.lang.String insert​(java.lang.String str, int width, java.lang.String s)
      Returns a string obtained by (1) splitting a specified string into sections where the maximum width of each section is specified, (2) inserting another specified string between every two successive sections, and (3) combining all back to a string. In splitting a string into sections, a Scanner is used to prevent the break of a word.
      Parameters:
      str - a string
      width - the maximum width of sections
      s - a string to be inserted between sections
      Returns:
      a string obtained from str by inserting s into it

    • getLongestCommonPrefix

      public static java.lang.String getLongestCommonPrefix​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b)
      Returns the longest common prefix of two strings.
      Parameters:
      a - a string
      b - a string
      Returns:
      the longest common prefix of the two input strings

    • getMinimalEditingCost

      public static int getMinimalEditingCost​(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String t)
      Returns the minimal editing costs for changing a string to another string.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to be changed
      t - the target string
      Returns:
      the minimal editing costs for changing s to t

    • inclusiveSplit

      public static java.lang.String[] inclusiveSplit​(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String delim)
      Split a string with delimiters represented by a regular expression. The delimiters will be included.
      Parameters:
      input - an input string
      delim - the delimiters represented by a regular expression
      Returns:
      the split string

    • inclusiveSplit

      public static java.lang.String[] inclusiveSplit​(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String delim, int limit)
      Split a string with delimiters represented by a regular expression. The delimiters will be included. See the post on Stack Overflow for more details.
      Parameters:
      input - an input string
      delim - the delimiters represented by a regular expression
      limit - the result threshold
      Returns:
      the split string
